page.title: 04ST PETERS LENTON
page.content: St.Peter's Lenton St.Peter's Church was built in the 12th century.There are a number of old graves in the graveyard dating from 1308.They still bury people in the graveyard the latest burial was last year 1984. In 1701 Mary Parnham gave Â£100 to a free school for boys and girls at which 5 poor children of the parish of Lenton were taught free.The Parnham Charity still exists today. Money is given to the schools of both Ingoldsby and Corby Glen,which Lenton children attend. The spire at St.Peters Church was restored in 1897 in commemoration of Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee.In 1879 the Church was reroofed and reseated at a cost of Â£1700, the Earl of Ancaster gave Â£700 and the Earl of Dysart gave Â£300.
